column3: Could you devise a simple scheme for representing the following within an ontology context: Way Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column4: In the context of ontology, "Way" is quite an abstract term. It could refer to a method, a route, a manner, a direction, etc. Let's assume "Way" as a method of doing something for this task.```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.com/> .ex:Method a rdf:Class ;  rdfs:label "Method"@en ;  rdfs:comment "A way of doing something"@en .ex:cookMethod a ex:Method ;  rdfs:label "Cooking method"@en .ex:bake a ex:cookMethod ;  rdfs:label "Baking"@en ;  rdfs:comment "A cooking method that involves dry heat in an oven"@en .ex:fry a ex:cookMethod ;  rdfs:label "Frying"@en ;  rdfs:comment "A cooking method that involves cooking food in hot oil or fat"@en .```In this example, "Method" (representing a way of doing something) is a class. There are different methods of cooking such as "baking" and "frying". Each of these cooking methods is an instance of the "Method" class.
